name: system-security
description: SSH configuration, firewall setup, and system security tools

ssh-config.name: ssh-config
ssh-config.description: Configure SSH for secure remote access

commands.install: sudo systemctl enable ssh && sudo systemctl start ssh && sudo sed -i 's/#PermitRootLogin yes/PermitRootLogin no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config && sudo sed -i 's/#PasswordAuthentication yes/PasswordAuthentication no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config && sudo systemctl restart ssh
commands.remove: sudo systemctl stop ssh && sudo systemctl disable ssh

commands.install: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y ufw && sudo ufw --force enable && sudo ufw default deny incoming && sudo ufw default allow outgoing && sudo ufw allow ssh && sudo ufw allow 22/tcp
commands.remove: sudo ufw --force disable && sudo apt remove -y ufw
commands.update: sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y ufw

commands.install: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y fail2ban && sudo systemctl enable fail2ban && sudo systemctl start fail2ban
commands.remove: sudo systemctl stop fail2ban && sudo systemctl disable fail2ban && sudo apt remove -y fail2ban
commands.update: sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y fail2ban

commands.install: sudo apt update && sudo apt install -y openssh-server
commands.update: sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y openssh-server
